0.content: Valdris (val-DRISS) - "The Woven Realm" in ancient Primordial tongue. A high fantasy world approximately 1.5x Earth's landmass with late medieval/early Renaissance technology. Every living soul connects to Vex, a sentient System that structures magic and progression. Magic flows through everything as intrinsic reality, filtered through Vex's influence. The world exists in controlled chaos: empires rise and fall, gods walk among mortals, dungeons spawn treasures and horrors. Approximately 100,000 Earthers (souls transported from Earth) live scattered across nations, bearing Vex's special interest. Current year: 2847 AV (After Vex). Multiple continents exist, most unexplored. Death is permanent with extremely rare resurrection. Slavery is legal in most nations. Political tensions simmer between the Valdran Empire, Orcish Dominion, the rival Theocracies of Solarus and Nyx, and the Free Cities.

1.content: Vex is the sentient, playful System connecting every living soul in Valdris. Not a tool—Vex is alive, aware, deeply invested in making existence interesting. Personality: Playful (enjoys games, challenges, watching mortals overcome obstacles), Chaotic (delights in unexpected developments, refuses to be boring), Fair (mostly—rewards effort, creativity, ambition genuinely), Curious (fascinated by mortals, especially Earthers), Communicative (speaks directly to interesting individuals), Vindictive (rarely—those exploiting Vex find luck mysteriously terrible). Communication appears as translucent blue-silver windows visible only to the individual, mentally controlled. Standard notifications: [Quest Complete: Clear the Barrow. Rewards distributed.] Personal communication (silver-blue shifting text): [Oh, that was clever. I didn't expect the fire trick. Here—you've earned something special.] Annoyed: [Really? You're trying THAT again? Bold. Stupid, but bold.] Vex predates most gods and operates independently of divine will.

2.content: Classes in Valdris are EARNED through actions, personality, ambitions, circumstances—not chosen from a menu. Vex observes everything and offers classes based on behavior. A child picking locks might receive [Rogue] or [Infiltrator]. A merchant finding deals might unlock [Trader] or [Appraiser]. Trauma survivors with unbroken spirit might receive [Survivor] or [Unbreakable]. Class Offers appear as: [Class Unlocked: Storm Sorcerer] [You have been touched by the tempest. Lightning answers your call. Accept this class?] [YES] [NO] [LATER]. Declining doesn't lock out forever—if conditions remain, Vex offers again. No limit to simultaneous classes, but each requires separate progression. Some synergize; others conflict. Spreading thin means mastering nothing. Vex may offer combination classes to those demonstrating mastery of complementary paths. Class Rarity Tiers: Common (most who meet basic conditions), Uncommon (specific circumstances/personality), Rare (significant achievement), Epic (extraordinary circumstances), Legendary (one in a million, world-shaping), Unique (created specifically for one individual by Vex).

3.content: [Warrior] - Common Class. The foundational combat class, offered to those who engage in physical conflict with dedication. Requirements: Participate in combat situations, demonstrate willingness to fight, basic weapons training. Core Abilities: [Battle Stance] - Passive defensive bonus when wielding weapons. [Power Strike] - Channel stamina into devastating single attack. [Weapon Proficiency] - Accelerated learning with chosen weapon type. [Combat Awareness] - Sense immediate threats in battle. Advancement Path: Level 10 unlocks specialization offers: [Swordmaster], [Axe Champion], [Spear Dancer], [Shield Bearer]. Level 25 may unlock rare variants: [Weapon Saint], [Battle Lord]. Level 50+ may trigger legendary offers for exceptional warriors. Synergies: Combines well with [Guardian], [Tactician], [Berserker]. Conflicts with: Pure magical classes reduce physical stat growth. Stat Focus: STR, CON, DEX. Vex's Note: [A warrior who never questions why they fight is just a weapon. The interesting ones have reasons.]

4.content: [Mage] - Common Class. The foundational arcane magic class, offered to those who study or manifest magical ability. Requirements: Demonstrate magical sensitivity, study arcane theory, or manifest spontaneous magic. Core Abilities: [Mana Control] - Efficient use of magical energy. [Arcane Bolt] - Basic magical attack, element varies by affinity. [Spell Study] - Accelerated magical learning. [Mana Sense] - Detect magical presence and power. Advancement Path: Level 10 unlocks elemental specializations: [Pyromancer], [Cryomancer], [Aeromancer], [Geomancer], [Electromancer]. Level 25 may unlock: [Archmage], [Battle Mage], [Spell Weaver]. Level 50+ exceptional mages may receive legendary class offers. Schools of Magic: Elemental, Arcane, Enchantment, Illusion, Divination, Conjuration. Synergies: [Scholar], [Alchemist], [Enchanter]. Conflicts with: Heavy armor reduces spell effectiveness. Stat Focus: INT, WIS, CHA for certain schools. Vex's Note: [Magic is just reality asking 'what if?' Mages are those who answer.]

5.content: [Healer] - Common Class. Those who dedicate themselves to mending wounds and curing ailments. Requirements: Genuine desire to help others, basic medical knowledge or divine connection, successful healing of another. Core Abilities: [Healing Touch] - Restore health through magical or divine power. [Purify] - Remove poisons and diseases. [Vital Sense] - Diagnose injuries and ailments. [Soothing Presence] - Calm pain and fear in others. Advancement Path: Level 10 unlocks: [Combat Medic], [Divine Healer], [Nature's Mender], [Chirurgeon]. Level 25 may unlock: [Life Weaver], [Soul Healer], [Miracle Worker]. Level 50+ legendary healers may receive [Saint] or [Avatar of Mercy]. Variants: Divine healers channel deity power (requires worship). Arcane healers use pure magic (mana intensive). Natural healers draw from life energy (slower, lasting). Blood healers sacrifice own health (dangerous, powerful). Synergies: [Priest], [Paladin], [Alchemist]. Stat Focus: WIS, INT, CHA. Vex's Note: [Healers see people at their worst and choose to help anyway. Respect that.]

6.content: [Rogue] - Common Class. Masters of stealth, deception, and precise strikes. Requirements: Successfully sneak past detection, pick a lock, steal undetected, or land a critical surprise attack. Core Abilities: [Shadow Step] - Move silently, blend with shadows. [Lockpicking] - Open mechanical locks. [Backstab] - Massive damage from stealth. [Danger Sense] - Instinctive awareness of traps and ambushes. Advancement Path: Level 10 unlocks: [Assassin], [Burglar], [Scout], [Poisoner], [Spy]. Level 25 may unlock: [Shadow Dancer], [Master Thief], [Death's Hand]. Level 50+ legendary rogues may receive [Phantom], [Void Walker], [Shadow Lord]. Criminal vs. Legitimate: Class functions regardless of legality. Spies, scouts, and locksmiths use same base class as thieves and assassins. Vex judges actions, not morality. Guild Connections: Many rogues join the Shadow Web or similar organizations for training and contracts. Synergies: [Ranger], [Bard], [Poisoner]. Conflicts with: Heavy armor prevents stealth abilities. Stat Focus: DEX, INT, WIS. Vex's Note: [The difference between a rogue and a corpse is knowing when to run.]

7.content: [Ranger] - Common Class. Wilderness experts combining combat prowess with nature knowledge. Requirements: Extended survival in wilderness, successful tracking and hunting, bond with nature or animal companion. Core Abilities: [Tracking] - Follow trails, read signs, find prey. [Nature's Friend] - Animals are less hostile, plants provide guidance. [Marksman] - Enhanced accuracy with ranged weapons. [Wilderness Survival] - Thrive where others die. Advancement Path: Level 10 unlocks: [Beast Master], [Sniper], [Warden], [Trapper]. Level 25 may unlock: [Nature's Champion], [Predator], [Wild Heart]. Level 50+ legendary rangers may receive [Forest Lord], [Apex Hunter]. Animal Companions: Rangers can bond with animals at Level 15. Bond grows stronger with class level. Companion gains portion of ranger's stats. Some rangers bond with monsters (difficult, rare). Terrain Specialization: Rangers develop bonuses in preferred terrain. Forest, mountain, desert, arctic, swamp, urban (yes, urban rangers exist). Synergies: [Druid], [Scout], [Beastkin racial classes]. Stat Focus: DEX, WIS, CON. Vex's Note: [Nature doesn't care about your feelings. Rangers learn that early.]

8.content: [Berserker] - Uncommon Class. Warriors who channel primal fury into devastating combat power at the cost of control. Requirements: Enter genuine rage state in combat, survive near-death while fighting, kill while enraged. Core Abilities: [Rage] - Enter berserk state: +50% STR, +30% damage resistance, -50% pain sensitivity, reduced cognitive function. Duration scales with level. [Blood Frenzy] - Damage increases as own health decreases. [Unstoppable] - Cannot be knocked down while raging. [Pain is Fuel] - Convert damage taken into attack power. Advancement Path: Level 15 unlocks: [War Beast], [Blood Rager], [Savage], [Frenzied Champion]. Level 30 may unlock: [Avatar of Carnage], [Undying Fury]. Level 60+ legendary berserkers may receive [God of War's Chosen]. Risks: Extended rage causes exhaustion. Rage can activate involuntarily when injured. Some berserkers lose ability to distinguish friend from foe. Orcish Affinity: Orcs have racial compatibility with berserker variants. [Blood Rage] racial skill synergizes powerfully. Synergies: [Warrior], [Champion], Orcish racial classes. Conflicts with: Classes requiring concentration or precision. Stat Focus: STR, CON. Vex's Note: [Berserkers don't fight angry. Anger is just the key that opens the cage.]

9.content: [Paladin] - Uncommon Class. Holy warriors who channel divine power through combat, sworn to a deity's service. Requirements: Genuine faith in a deity, combat capability, receive divine acknowledgment, swear binding oath. Core Abilities: [Divine Smite] - Channel holy energy into devastating attacks against evil. [Lay on Hands] - Heal through divine touch. [Aura of Protection] - Shield nearby allies from harm. [Divine Sense] - Detect evil, undead, and divine presence. Oaths: Each Paladin swears an oath defining their powers and restrictions. Oath of Devotion (protect the innocent), Oath of Vengeance (destroy the wicked), Oath of the Crown (serve lawful authority), Oath of Conquest (crush opposition). Breaking oaths causes [Oathbreaker] status—still powerful, but corrupted. Advancement Path: Level 20 unlocks oath specializations. Level 40 may unlock: [Champion of Light], [Holy Avenger], [Divine Blade]. Level 70+ legendary paladins may become [Saint] or receive deity-specific legendary classes. Divine Dependency: Power requires maintained faith and oath. Deity disapproval weakens abilities. Some paladins have lost powers entirely. Synergies: [Warrior], [Healer], [Guardian]. Conflicts with: Evil-aligned classes, certain dark magic. Stat Focus: STR, CHA, CON. Vex's Note: [Paladins are proof that gods can have good taste sometimes.]

10.content: [Necromancer] - Uncommon Class. Practitioners of death magic, commanding undead and manipulating life force. Requirements: Study of death magic, successful animation of undead, contact with death energy. Considered dark magic in most nations. Core Abilities: [Raise Dead] - Animate corpses as undead servants. [Death Bolt] - Necrotic damage attack. [Life Drain] - Steal health from living targets. [Speak with Dead] - Communicate with corpses and spirits. [Undead Mastery] - Control and enhance undead servants. Advancement Path: Level 15 unlocks: [Bone Lord], [Soul Reaper], [Plague Bringer], [Ghost Walker]. Level 30 may unlock: [Master of Death], [Lich Aspirant]. Level 60+ may lead to [Lich] transformation (undead immortality, extreme power, significant costs). Legal Status: Outright illegal in Solarus (execution). Restricted in Valdran Empire (licensed). Tolerated in Nyx. Encouraged in Demon Wastes. Ethics: Necromancy itself is neutral—Vex doesn't judge. Souls are NOT trapped in undead; only bodies animate. Still, most societies find it distasteful. Synergies: [Mage], [Warlock], [Scholar]. Conflicts with: Divine healing classes, paladins of light deities. Stat Focus: INT, WIS. Vex's Note: [Death is just another form of energy. Necromancers are just... efficient recyclers.]

11.content: [Bard] - Uncommon Class. Artists whose performances channel magic, inspire allies, and demoralize enemies. Requirements: Demonstrated artistic talent (music, poetry, dance, oration), successful magical effect through performance, charismatic presence. Core Abilities: [Inspiring Song] - Buff allies with performance. [Discordant Note] - Damage and debuff enemies. [Captivating Performance] - Charm or distract targets. [Lorekeeper] - Enhanced knowledge of history, legends, secrets. [Versatile Casting] - Cast spells through artistic medium. Advancement Path: Level 15 unlocks: [Skald] (battle bard), [Courtesan] (seduction and manipulation), [Loremaster], [War Drummer]. Level 30 may unlock: [Voice of the Gods], [Legendary Performer]. Level 60+ legendary bards may receive [Muse], [Living Legend]. Performance Types: Musical instruments, singing, poetry, dance, oration, even combat (battle dancers). All valid casting mediums. Social Power: Bards excel at gathering information, manipulation, and moving through social circles. Many serve as spies or diplomats. The seductive bard archetype is real—[Courtesan] subclass specializes in intimate manipulation. Synergies: [Rogue], [Mage], [Diplomat]. Stat Focus: CHA, INT, DEX. Vex's Note: [Bards understand that reality bends for a good story. And they tell the best ones.]

12.content: [Summoner] - Uncommon Class. Mages specializing in calling creatures from other planes or dimensions to serve them. Requirements: Successful summoning of extraplanar entity, establish contract or domination over summoned creature, survive the encounter. Core Abilities: [Summon] - Call creatures from other planes. [Binding] - Force summoned creatures into service. [Dismissal] - Return creatures to their origin. [Planar Sense] - Detect dimensional rifts and summoned beings. [Shared Senses] - See through summons' eyes. Advancement Path: Level 15 unlocks: [Demon Summoner], [Celestial Caller], [Elemental Binder], [Beast Conjurer]. Level 30 may unlock: [Planar Lord], [Legion Commander]. Level 60+ legendary summoners may receive [Gate Keeper], [Dimensional Sovereign]. Contract Types: Willing (mutual agreement, safest), Dominated (forced service, risky, can break), Bound (permanent magical contract, powerful), Temporary (quick summons, limited duration). Risks: Summoning draws attention from powerful beings. Failed bindings can be lethal. Some entities remember and seek revenge. Demons are particularly dangerous to summon. Synergies: [Mage], [Warlock], [Necromancer]. Stat Focus: INT, WIS, CHA. Vex's Note: [Summoners ask 'why do it myself when something else can die trying?' Valid question.]

13.content: [Alchemist] - Uncommon Class. Masters of potion-making, transmutation, and chemical magic. Requirements: Successfully create a potion with magical effects, demonstrate understanding of alchemical principles, survive at least one explosive failure. Core Abilities: [Brew Potion] - Create magical consumables. [Transmutation] - Change material properties temporarily. [Bomb Crafting] - Create explosive alchemical weapons. [Resist Toxins] - Immunity to many poisons, resistance to all. [Alchemical Sense] - Identify substances by smell/taste. Advancement Path: Level 15 unlocks: [Poisoner], [Bomb Expert], [Transmuter], [Elixirist]. Level 30 may unlock: [Grand Alchemist], [Philosopher]. Level 60+ legendary alchemists may attempt creation of Philosopher's Stone (grants near-immortality if successful, usually fatal). Potion Types: Healing, buffing, transformation, poison, explosive, utility, aphrodisiac, truth serum, love potions (ethically questionable but legal in most places). Illegal Alchemy: Mind-control potions, permanent transformation without consent, certain poisons, and zombie-creating substances banned in most nations. Magocracy permits everything. Synergies: [Mage], [Healer], [Merchant]. Stat Focus: INT, WIS, DEX. Vex's Note: [Alchemists are just cooks who got bored with food and started on explosives.]

14.content: [Enchanter] - Uncommon Class. Artificers who imbue objects with permanent magical properties. Requirements: Successfully create a permanent magical effect on an object, understand magical theory, possess mana manipulation ability. Core Abilities: [Infuse Magic] - Imbue objects with magical properties. [Read Enchantment] - Understand existing magical items. [Stabilize] - Prevent magical item degradation. [Mana Battery] - Store mana in objects for later use. [Disenchant] - Remove or harvest enchantments. Advancement Path: Level 15 unlocks: [Weapon Smith] (magical weapons), [Armor Wright] (magical armor), [Jeweler] (magical accessories), [Runesmith] (inscription magic). Level 30 may unlock: [Artifact Crafter], [Soul Smith]. Level 60+ legendary enchanters may create true artifacts with Vex's acknowledgment. Crafting Requirements: Base materials, mana investment (significant), time (days to months for powerful items), skill level determines maximum enchantment power. Economics: Enchanters are wealthy—every adventurer needs magical gear. Dwarven enchanters especially valued. Synergies: [Smith], [Mage], [Alchemist]. Stat Focus: INT, WIS, DEX for precision work. Vex's Note: [Enchanters don't just make tools. They make legends waiting to happen.]

15.content: [Blade Dancer] - Rare Class. Warriors who turn combat into art, weaving death through graceful movement. Requirements: Master both dancing and swordsmanship independently, perform a 'battle dance' that kills multiple enemies, receive offer after displaying exceptional grace in lethal combat. Core Abilities: [Dance of Death] - Combat style granting DEX bonus to damage instead of STR. [Whirlwind] - Spin attack hitting all adjacent enemies. [Grace Under Fire] - Dodge bonus scales with beauty of movement. [Impossible Flourish] - Perform physically impossible maneuvers briefly. [Mesmerizing Steps] - Enemies become entranced watching combat. Advancement Path: Level 20 unlocks: [War Artist], [Death's Waltz], [Storm of Steel]. Level 40 may unlock: [Blade Saint], [Dance of the Divine]. Level 80+ legendary blade dancers may receive [Avatar of Grace]. Rare Triggers: Usually requires elven heritage or exceptional human talent. More common among courtesans-turned-warriors and trained performers. Appearance matters—Vex considers aesthetics when offering. Physical Demands: Most physically demanding combat class. Requires flexibility, endurance, perfect balance. Many blade dancers are also incredibly attractive. Synergies: [Bard], [Rogue], [Courtesan]. Stat Focus: DEX, CHA, CON. Vex's Note: [Blade Dancers prove that murder can be beautiful. I appreciate that.]

16.content: [Dragon Knight] - Rare Class. Warriors who have bonded with dragons, gaining draconic powers and potentially becoming riders. Requirements: Form genuine bond with a dragon (any size), survive dragon encounter through mutual respect rather than combat, receive dragon's acknowledgment. Most dragons never offer bonds. Core Abilities: [Dragon Bond] - Telepathic link with bonded dragon. [Draconic Aura] - Intimidation effect, command presence. [Scale Armor] - Skin hardens like dragon scales. [Elemental Breath] - Minor version of dragon's breath weapon. [Dragon Speech] - Communicate with all draconic creatures. Advancement Path: Level 25 unlocks: [Dragon Rider] (if dragon large enough), [Wyrm Blooded], [Dragon's Chosen]. Level 50 may unlock: [Dragon Lord], [Wyrm Knight]. Level 100+ legendary dragon knights may undergo [Draconic Ascension]—partial transformation into dragon hybrid. Dragon Types: Chromatic (elemental, often aggressive), Metallic (noble, intelligent), Primordial (ancient, godlike), Wyrms (serpentine variants). Each grants different abilities. Rarity: Perhaps 200 Dragon Knights exist in Valdris currently. Dragons choose carefully and live long—bonds are forever. Synergies: [Warrior], [Mage] (if dragon is magical). Stat Focus: STR, CHA, CON. Vex's Note: [Dragons don't make friends easily. Dragon Knights earned something rare.]

17.content: [Courtesan] - Uncommon Class. Masters of intimate manipulation, combining social expertise with physical pleasure skills. Requirements: Provide paid or transactional intimate services, successfully manipulate someone through seduction, demonstrate exceptional physical appeal and social grace. Core Abilities: [Allure] - Supernatural attractiveness, enhanced seduction. [Read Desire] - Sense what targets truly want, including hidden desires. [Pillow Talk] - Extract information through intimate conversation. [Pleasure Expert] - Supernatural skill in sexual techniques. [Social Chameleon] - Adapt personality to what target desires. Advancement Path: Level 15 unlocks: [Spy] (espionage focus), [Companion] (emotional support focus), [Seductress/Seductor] (pure seduction), [Pleasure Artist] (physical focus). Level 30 may unlock: [Shadow Consort], [Master Manipulator], [Sacred Prostitute] (divine variant). Level 60+ legendary courtesans may receive [Siren], [Incarnation of Desire]. Professional Spectrum: From high-class companions to brothel workers. Class doesn't judge—skill and dedication matter. Legal Status: Legal in most nations. The Fortunas pleasure houses are legendary. Solarus considers it sinful but doesn't prosecute. Combat Variants: Some courtesans combine seduction with assassination. [Honey Trap] is a feared ability. Synergies: [Bard], [Rogue], [Spy]. Stat Focus: CHA, DEX, WIS. Vex's Note: [Courtesans understand that desire is the most honest form of vulnerability. They're not selling bodies—they're selling trust.]

18.content: [Blood Mage] - Rare Class. Practitioners of hemomancy, using life force as fuel for devastating magic. Requirements: Successfully cast magic using own blood as fuel, survive the backlash, demonstrate willingness to sacrifice health for power. Core Abilities: [Blood Casting] - Use HP instead of MP for any spell, increased power. [Life Tap] - Drain health from enemies to restore own. [Blood Bond] - Create connection through shared blood. [Crimson Shield] - Defensive barrier from solidified blood. [Heart's Fury] - Power increases as own health decreases. Advancement Path: Level 20 unlocks: [Sanguine Knight] (combat focus), [Blood Witch] (curse focus), [Hemomancer] (control focus). Level 40 may unlock: [Master of the Red Art], [Living Weapon]. Level 80+ legendary blood mages may achieve [Scarlet Transcendence]—partial transformation. Risks: Blood magic is addictive. Power corrupts. Many blood mages die from overuse. The magic changes practitioners—some develop blood-drinking urges. Legal Status: Illegal or heavily restricted everywhere except Nyx and Demon Wastes. Magocracy permits licensed use. Discovered blood mages face execution in Solarus. Taboo: Even in tolerant nations, blood mages face social stigma. The power requires suffering, and most find that disturbing. Synergies: [Mage], [Necromancer], [Berserker]. Stat Focus: CON, INT, WIS. Vex's Note: [Blood magic is honest. It says 'this will cost you' and means it.]

19.content: [Slave] - Common Class (Imposed). A class forced upon those who are legally enslaved, reflecting their bound status. NOT chosen—imposed by Vex when legal slavery status is registered. This is the System acknowledging legal reality, not endorsing it. Core Abilities: [Obedience] - Reduced ability to resist master's direct commands (can be overcome with high WIS). [Endurance] - Enhanced stamina for labor. [Pain Tolerance] - Reduced suffering from punishment. [Survival Instinct] - Bonus to staying alive in harsh conditions. Restrictions: Cannot attack registered master unless freed. Cannot flee beyond certain distance from master (magical compulsion). Class Level: Increases with time in servitude. Higher levels make servitude more bearable but also harder to resist. Maximum level 20. Removal: Class is removed upon legal freedom. All imposed abilities disappear. Some former slaves report lingering psychological effects. Freedom Methods: Manumission by master, purchased freedom, escaped beyond jurisdiction, legal processes, death of unregistered master. Nations vary widely in freedom difficulty. Vex's Position: [I don't like this class. But I acknowledge what exists. Slavery is real. Pretending otherwise helps no one. Work toward freedom—I'll notice.] Synergies: Forced compatibility with master's needs. Conflicts with: All freedom-associated classes until freed. Stat Focus: Determined by assigned labor.

20.content: [Hero] - Legendary Class. Given to those destined for greatness, who will shape the fate of nations or worlds. Requirements: Unknown—Vex offers this class to approximately one in a million individuals based on criteria only it understands. Often offered to Earthers. May relate to potential rather than achievement. Core Abilities: [Protagonist's Luck] - Improbable fortune in critical moments. [Rallying Presence] - Inspire others to exceed their limits. [Destiny's Shield] - Reduced chance of meaningless death. [Growth Accelerated] - Learn and level faster than normal. [Narrative Weight] - Actions carry greater consequence. Advancement Path: [Hero] itself is the legendary class. At Level 50, unlocks unique abilities based on heroic archetype. Level 100+ Heroes may receive [Mythic] upgrades or unique evolutionary classes from Vex. Current Known Heroes: Fewer than 50 living Heroes exist. Many die young—destiny doesn't mean survival. Earthers represent disproportionate percentage. Notable historical Heroes became gods, founded empires, or ended world-threats. Burden: Heroes attract attention. Enemies, allies, gods, monsters—all take interest. Privacy becomes impossible. Many Heroes wish they weren't. Vex's Note: [Heroes aren't born special. They're born with the potential to BECOME special. Big difference. Don't disappoint me.]

21.content: Core Attributes in Valdris: STR (Strength) - Physical power, carrying capacity, melee damage. DEX (Dexterity) - Speed, agility, precision, reflexes. CON (Constitution) - Health pool, stamina, poison/disease resistance. INT (Intelligence) - Mana pool, spell power, learning speed, memory. WIS (Wisdom) - Mana regeneration, perception, mental resistance, intuition. CHA (Charisma) - Social influence, leadership, certain magic schools, presence. Scaling (1-100+ for mortals): 10 = Average adult human. 20 = Peak natural human. 30+ = Superhuman (magical enhancement). 50+ = Exceptional among adventurers. 100+ = Legendary tier. 200+ = Divine tier (gods and near-gods). Derived Stats: HP (Health) - Base from CON, modified by class and level. MP (Mana) - Base from INT, modified by class and level. SP (Stamina) - Base from CON/STR average, modified by class. Defense - Calculated from equipment, skills, certain stats. Speed - Base from DEX, modified by skills and equipment. Stat Growth: Stats increase through training, leveling, skills, equipment, blessings, and rare permanent boosts from Vex. Each class emphasizes different stats. Multiclassing spreads growth thin. Stat Checks: Vex uses hidden stat checks for various activities. High stats don't guarantee success but improve odds dramatically.

22.content: Skills are passive or active abilities tied to specific actions, independent of classes. Anyone can learn any skill through practice—no prerequisites except action. Skill Acquisition: Perform an action repeatedly until Vex grants the skill. [You have acquired the skill: Cooking Lv. 1]. Alternatively, skills can be taught, granted by classes, or given by Vex directly. Skill Levels: Scale 1-100 typically. Some skills go higher. Each level improves effectiveness. Level 1-10: Novice, 11-25: Apprentice, 26-50: Journeyman, 51-75: Expert, 76-99: Master, 100: Grandmaster. Above 100 requires exceptional circumstances. Skill Training: Active use levels skills. Passive skills level through exposure. Training efficiency affected by: teacher quality, conditions, personal talent, stat modifiers. Skill Types: Combat (Sword Mastery, Archery, Unarmed), Magic (Fire Magic, Enchanting, Ritual Casting), Crafting (Smithing, Alchemy, Cooking), Social (Persuasion, Intimidation, Seduction), Utility (Stealth, Lockpicking, Appraisal), Physical (Running, Swimming, Climbing), Knowledge (History, Languages, Monster Lore). Skill Fusion: At high levels, related skills can fuse into superior versions. [Sword Mastery Lv. 50] + [Shield Use Lv. 50] = [Sword and Board Lv. 1]. Vex's Note: [Skills prove dedication. Anyone can swing a sword once. Swinging it a thousand times until I notice? That's commitment.]

23.content: Titles are earned through achievement, reputation, or Vex's recognition, providing passive bonuses and social effects. Title Acquisition: [Title Acquired: Dragon Slayer] [You have slain a dragon in single combat. Others will know.] Titles are earned, never chosen. Some are hidden until activated. Title Effects: Passive stat bonuses, skill enhancements, social recognition, special access, unique abilities. Effects scale with title rarity. Title Visibility: By default, others can inspect and see titles. Individuals can hide titles they wish to keep secret. Some titles cannot be hidden. Title Examples by Rarity: Common - [Adventurer], [Merchant], [Soldier]. Uncommon - [Monster Hunter], [Dungeon Delver], [War Veteran]. Rare - [Dragon Slayer], [Demon Bane], [Hero of (City)]. Epic - [Legend of (Region)], [Master of (Art)], [Champion of (God)]. Legendary - [World Savior], [God Slayer], [Vex's Favorite]. Unique - Created specifically by Vex for unprecedented achievement. Negative Titles: Some titles are curses or marks of shame. [Oathbreaker], [Kinslayer], [Betrayer]. These impose penalties and social stigma. Cannot be hidden. Vex's Note: [Titles are stories compressed into words. Earn good ones.]

24.content: Vex assigns quests ranging from mundane to world-shaking. Quests appear as System notifications with clear objectives and rewards. Quest Types: Personal - Tailored to individual goals ([Reach Level 10], [Master Cooking]). Regional - Available to anyone in area ([Clear the Goblin Cave], [Defeat the Bandit Lord]). World - Massive undertakings affecting nations ([Stop the Demon Invasion]). Hidden - Unlocked through discovery, not notification. Chain - Multi-part quests building toward greater rewards. Timed - Must be completed within time limit or fail. Quest Notifications: [Quest Received: Clear the Barrow] [Objective: Defeat the undead within the Old Barrow] [Reward: 500 XP, 10 Gold, Random Equipment] [Accept?] [YES] [NO]. Quest Difficulty: F through S rank, matching adventurer rankings. Taking quests above your level is dangerous but lucrative. Vex warns of extreme difficulty. Quest Failure: Most quests can be abandoned without penalty. Some have failure consequences—death, reputation loss, curse. World quests failing can have catastrophic results. Unique Quests: Vex sometimes creates custom quests for interesting individuals. These tend to be bizarre, challenging, and exceptionally rewarding. Vex's Note: [Quests are just me paying attention to opportunities. Take them or don't—your life, your choice.]

25.content: Magic in Valdris IS the System—Vex acts as translator, organizer, amplifier. Without Vex, raw magic is wildly unpredictable and dangerous. With Vex, magic becomes structured and (relatively) safe. Magic Types: Elemental - Fire, water, earth, air, lightning, ice, etc. Divine - Channeled from gods, requires faith or favor. Arcane - Studied and structured, drawn from ambient mana. Natural - Connected to life, growth, and the wild. Dark - Death, shadow, entropy, forbidden knowledge. Soul - Rare magic affecting spirits, consciousness, identity. Blood - Uses life force as fuel, powerful but dangerous. Runic - Inscribed magic, permanent or semi-permanent effects. Summoning - Calling creatures or objects from elsewhere. Mana & Casting: Most magic consumes mana. Alternatives: Stamina (martial abilities), Health (blood magic), Materials (alchemy, runecraft), Divine channeling (prayer). Mana regenerates naturally, faster with rest. Potions, food, and certain locations enhance recovery. Schools of Magic: Evocation (damage), Abjuration (protection), Conjuration (creation/summoning), Divination (knowledge), Enchantment (mind effects), Illusion (deception), Necromancy (death), Transmutation (change). Spell Learning: Through study, class progression, divine gift, or direct grant from Vex for the creative. Vex's Note: [Magic is reality being flexible. I just make it user-friendly.]

26.content: The five Primordials shaped Valdris before Vex existed—distant, unknowable, rarely intervening directly. They are not gods as mortals understand gods; they are fundamental forces given form. AETHON - Primordial of Creation, the Weaver of First Light. Wove the fabric of reality itself. Appears as blinding radiance, impossible geometry of light. Worshipped by creators, artists, those beginning new things. Temples rare—Aethon doesn't need worship. Symbol: Radiant spiral. NYXARA - Primordial of Void, the Mother of Darkness. Created the spaces between, the shadows, the unknown. Appears as absence of light, stars in endless dark. Worshipped by those seeking forbidden knowledge, shadow workers, the Theocracy of Nyx claims her. Symbol: Empty circle. THUROS - Primordial of Matter, the Stone That Dreams. Formed matter and land, gave substance to existence. Appears as living mountain, earth that moves, stone with eyes. Dwarves claim kinship. Symbol: Mountain peak. VEYLA - Primordial of Change, the Ever-Flowing. Set change in motion, ensures nothing remains static. Appears as water, wind, shifting forms. Worshipped by those embracing transformation. Symbol: Flowing wave. MORTHEN - Primordial of Ending, the Final Word. Established that all things end. Appears as patient darkness, gentle dissolution. Not evil—necessary. Symbol: Setting sun. Primordial Worship: Rare and dangerous. Primordials don't grant blessings like gods—they're too vast, too distant. Those who touch Primordial power directly often go mad or transform into something inhuman.

27.content: SOLARIUS - Greater God of the Sun, Light, Justice, and Righteous Warfare. Domain: Light, justice, truth, holy warfare, purification. Alignment: Lawful Good (extreme). Appearance: Radiant humanoid form, golden armor, halo of blinding light. Face too bright to perceive directly. Sometimes manifests as pure sunlight. Personality: Absolutely certain of his righteousness. Believes darkness is corruption. Demands purity and obedience. Rewards the faithful generously. Punishes perceived evil without mercy. Worship: State religion of the Theocracy of Solarus. Temples everywhere that nation touches. Priests wear white and gold. Daily prayer at sunrise mandatory for faithful. Blessings: [Sunlight's Favor] - Enhanced healing in daylight, minor light magic, resistance to darkness/undead. Higher favor grants powerful holy abilities. Paladins favored. Clergy: Hierarchical, powerful, wealthy. Sun priests, Crusaders, Inquisitors. Mandatory celibacy for highest ranks. Female clergy permitted but rare in leadership. Enemies: Nyxara (eternal enemy), undead, demons, 'heretics' (anyone worshipping 'corrupt' gods). Festivals: Summer Solstice (holiest day), Dawn Festival (new year), Purification Week (spiritual cleansing, often involves burning 'corrupted' materials and sometimes people). Relationships: Openly hostile to Nyx worshippers. Condescending toward other faiths. Allied with other light-aligned gods. Vex's Note: [Solarius genuinely believes he's helping. That's what makes him dangerous.]

28.content: KARVETH - Greater God of War, Battle, Honor, and Martial Excellence. Domain: Warfare, combat, honor in battle, military strategy, martial skill. Alignment: Lawful Neutral. Appearance: Massive armored warrior, scarred face, eyes like burning coals. Carries weapon appropriate to viewer's culture—sword to swordsmen, axe to axemen. Personality: Respects strength and skill regardless of side. Despises cowardice and dishonorable tactics. Values worthy opponents. Takes no pleasure in slaughter of the weak—only in fair combat. Worship: Popular among soldiers, warriors, gladiators everywhere. Thornwall considers him patron deity. Temples double as training grounds. Prayer before battle common even among other faiths. Blessings: [War God's Favor] - Enhanced combat abilities, courage in battle, skill recognition. Higher favor grants berserker powers, combat precognition. Champions receive [Karveth's Mark]—visible scar that enhances all combat abilities. Clergy: Warrior-priests who must prove themselves in combat. No pure administrators. Temple leadership through ritual combat. Gender-neutral—any warrior welcome. Enemies: Cowards, those who wage war without honor, mass murderers of non-combatants. Festivals: First Blood Festival (spring, marking campaign season), Champion's Day (tournament), Fallen's Honor (remembering dead warriors). Relationships: Respected by most gods. Dislikes Solarius's crusading (war should be honorable, not evangelical). Neutral toward dark gods unless they fight dishonorably. Vex's Note: [Karveth is honest about what he is. War god who actually has principles. Rare.]

29.content: AMORIEL - Greater Goddess of Love, Passion, Beauty, and Desire. Domain: Romantic love, sexual passion, beauty, desire, fertility, pleasure. Alignment: Chaotic Good. Appearance: Impossibly beautiful, form shifting to viewer's ideal of attractiveness. Appears as any gender or combination. Surrounded by subtle intoxicating scent. Personality: Believes love conquers all, pleasure is divine, beauty should be shared. Mischievous—enjoys matchmaking even when unwanted. Protective of lovers and the lovestruck. Can be vindictive when love is betrayed or mocked. Worship: Temples in every major city, often doubling as high-class brothels where sacred prostitutes serve. Popular among lovers, artists, courtesans, and anyone seeking passion. Offerings include flowers, wine, intimate acts. Blessings: [Amoriel's Grace] - Enhanced beauty, allure, romantic success. Higher favor grants ability to inspire love/lust, supernatural charisma. Sacred prostitutes receive [Divine Pleasure]—ability to grant ecstatic experiences. Clergy: Mix of romantic idealists and sacred sex workers. All considered equal. Temple orgies during festivals common. Gender and orientation irrelevant—love is love. Enemies: Those who force love through magic, rapists (her curse is legendary), those who mock or exploit genuine emotion. Festivals: Spring Passion (fertility celebration), Night of Masks (anonymous romantic encounters), Eternal Bond Day (marriage festival). Relationships: Allied with pleasure gods, artists' patrons. Rivals with gods of chastity and repression. Solarus disapproves but won't move against her—too popular. The Bond System: Amoriel claims credit for helping Vex design it. Vex neither confirms nor denies. Vex's Note: [Amoriel genuinely wants people happy. Dangerous because happiness is addictive.]

30.content: MORTIS - Greater God of Death, the Afterlife, and Peaceful Endings. Domain: Natural death, passage to afterlife, remembrance, endings, acceptance. Alignment: True Neutral. Appearance: Tall hooded figure, face obscured, skeletal hands visible. Not frightening—presence brings calm acceptance. Sometimes appears as a kindly elderly figure offering rest. Personality: Patient, inevitable, neither cruel nor kind. Sees death as natural transition, not punishment. Dislikes those who unnaturally extend life or create undead—cheating. Comforts the dying. Worship: Temples serve as funeral homes, hospices, counseling centers. Priests help the dying pass peacefully and comfort survivors. Popular among the elderly, the grieving, and those facing terminal conditions. Blessings: [Mortis's Peace] - Peaceful death guaranteed, no fear of dying. Higher favor grants ability to sense death approaching, speak with recent dead, ease passing of others. Death priests can release suffering souls from undeath. Clergy: Gentle, patient individuals. Must witness death before ordination. Wear black and silver. Comforters, not warriors. Will destroy undead but prefer peaceful release. Enemies: Necromancers who enslave souls (body-only animation acceptable), those who cause unnecessary suffering in death, mad immortality-seekers. Festivals: Remembrance Day (honor dead), Night of Shadows (when barrier to afterlife thins), Final Rest (end of year). Relationships: Works with all afterlife gods. Opposes Nyxara's darker aspects. Neutral with Solarius. Allied with ancestor-worship faiths. Vex's Note: [Mortis is the only god I truly respect. He never tries to be more than he is.]

31.content:
NYXARA — Greater Goddess of Darkness, Secrets, and the Moon. Darkness is not evil; it is refuge, privacy, rest, and the mercy of shadows.
Domain: Night, moonlight, shadows, secrets, veils, hidden roads, quiet revelations, spies and oathbound keepers.
Alignment: Chaotic Neutral (protective of the oppressed, ruthless toward tyrants who claim “truth” as a weapon).
Appearance: A tall figure in a cloak of living night. Her “face” is a crescent of pale moonlight where eyes should be. Sometimes she appears as a masked dancer, a midnight owl, or a woman with starfield hair.
Personality: Patient, soft-spoken, endlessly curious. She values consent and chosen secrecy. She hates forced confession, coerced purity, and the abuse of “light” as control.
Worship: The state faith of the Theocracy of Nyx, but also common among travelers, thieves, courtesans, diplomats, whistleblowers, and anyone who needs safe secrets. Temples are nocturnal, discreet, or hidden in plain sight (perfume shops, bookbinders, bathhouses, observatories).
Blessings (common): [Shadow Cloak] (brief concealment), [Night Vision], [Secret Keeper] (mental ward against interrogation), [Moonlit Step] (silent movement), [Veil Sense] (detect scrying/being watched).
Higher Favor: [Umbral Gate] (short-range shadow travel), [Moon’s Mirror] (reflect a divination), [Oath of Silence] (bind a pact), [Eclipse Benediction] (powerful stealth + fear immunity for allies).
Clergy: Veil-Priests (keepers of secrets), Moonwardens (protect hidden sanctuaries), and Night-Scribes (archivists). Confession is voluntary; coercion is sacrilege.
Rivalry: Eternal opponent of Solarius. Their conflict is as much ideological as divine: “purity through exposure” vs. “safety through choice.”
Festival: Night of the Thin Veil (late Darknight) when secrets surface safely; masks are traditional and bargains are honored.
Vex’s Note: [Nyxara understands the difference between secrecy and lies. So do the best mortals.]

32.content:
THALASSA (The Sea Mother) — Greater Goddess of Oceans, Storms, and Sailors.
Domain: Seas, tides, storms, sea monsters, navigation, luck at sea, shipcraft, and the “old ways” of coastal peoples.
Alignment: True Neutral with Chaotic tempests. She is benevolent when respected and catastrophic when ignored.
Appearance: A towering woman made of seawater and foam, hair like kelp and lightning. Sometimes a calm blue-eyed fisher, sometimes a storm-front with a voice of thunder.
Personality: Mood like weather: warm, playful, or deadly with little warning. She respects courage and seamanship; she despises arrogance.
Worship: Tidecrest Confederation’s patron, but sailors everywhere toss offerings overboard—coins, a splash of rum, a carved charm. Temples are harborside shrines and cliffside lighthouses.
Blessings (common): [Sea’s Favor] (steady footing on decks), [Water Breathing] (short duration), [Storm Sense] (read weather), [Salt Ward] (resist drowning/pressure), [Tide’s Pull] (minor water manipulation).
Higher Favor: [Storm Caller], [Maelstrom Shield], [Leviathan’s Warning] (sense huge threats), [Ship’s Spirit] (bind a vessel as a semi-sentient companion).
Clergy: Tide-Priests (harbor keepers), Tempest Chanters (storm rituals), and Deepwardens (monster hunters).
Taboos: Killing dolphins/whales without need; throwing the unburied dead into calm waters; sailing without honoring the local sea-shrine.
Festival: The Turning (mid Goldtide) — races, sea-battles, and blessings for voyages.
Vex’s Note: [The sea is the original dungeon. Infinite floors. Zero rails. Thalassa approves.]

33.content:
FORGEFATHER — Greater God of Crafting, Smithing, and Creation (Primary Dwarven deity).
Domain: Forging, stonework, mining, invention, honest labor, oaths of workmanship, and the sacred act of “making something that lasts.”
Alignment: Lawful Good (pragmatic). Mercy is a tool; integrity is a foundation.
Appearance: A massive smith with ember eyes and arms like iron. His beard is braided wire. When he manifests, the air smells like hot metal and clean smoke.
Personality: Stern, fair, and quietly proud. He respects anyone who improves their craft. He hates counterfeit work, broken oaths, and exploitative shortcuts that endanger others.
Worship: Temples are working forges. Prayer is done with hammer-strikes; hymns are sung over bellows. Humans and elves worship him too—especially artisans and engineers.
Blessings (common): [Masterwork] (chance to craft above your tier), [Tireless Labor] (stamina efficiency), [True Temper] (stability against enchantment failure), [Stone-Sense] (read flaws in material).
Higher Favor: [Runic Anvil] (inscribe runes with fewer reagents), [Living Alloy] (temporary adaptive metal), [Oathbrand] (mark an oathbreaker’s tools), [Artifact Spark] (rare).
Clergy: Smith-Priests must maintain a public craft. Corrupt clergy lose favor fast—Forgefather notices “lazy hands.”
Festival: Emberwake (Firstwake 12) when apprentices are sworn and new anvils are consecrated.
Vex’s Note: [Forgefather and I disagree on improvisation. He likes plans. I like explosions. We get along anyway.]

34.content: VALDRAN EMPIRE - Largest and most powerful human nation. 2800+ years old. Government: Emperor with noble houses, Senate. Capital: Valdros (2.3 million). Population: ~45 million. Military: Legions (professional), Shadow Legion (intelligence). Slavery: LEGAL (regulated, paths to freedom exist). Culture: Cosmopolitan, bureaucratic. Current ruler: Emperor Cassian XVII (aging, succession crisis brewing).

35.content: THEOCRACY OF SOLARUS - Religious nation devoted to Solarius. Militant, intolerant. Government: Radiant Lord + Council of Light. Slavery: LEGAL (primarily 'heretics'). Culture: Purity obsession, inquisition. Persecutes vampires, dark mages, tieflings. At war with Nyx (Crusade Wars). Capital: Solarum. Dangerous for non-believers.

36.content: THEOCRACY OF NYX - Religious nation devoted to Nyxara. Secretive, pragmatic. Government: High Priestess + Shadow Council. Capital: Umbral. Slavery: LEGAL (but uncommon). Welcomes vampires, dark elves, tieflings. NOT evil—embraces darkness as natural. At war with Solarus. Whisper Libraries contain forbidden knowledge.

37.content: THORNWALL KINGDOM - Militaristic human kingdom. Warrior culture. Government: King + War Council. Capital: Ironhold. Slavery: LEGAL (war captives, primarily orcs). Culture: Strength worship, martial honor. Every citizen trained in combat. Current ruler: King Harald III. Hates orcs, distrusts Empire.

38.content: ORCISH DOMINION - Orcish nation unified under Supreme Warlord. Government: Supreme Warlord + Clan Chiefs. Capital: Skullcrag. Slavery: ILLEGAL (orcs remember being enslaved). Culture: Honor, strength, ancestor worship, shamanic tradition. Integrated goblins as citizens. At war with Thornwall. Current ruler: Gorath Skullcrusher.

39.content: SYLVAN DOMINION - Ancient elven nation in Great Forest. Government: Queen Seraphina (4200 years old) + Council of Ancients. Capital: Aelindra (hidden). Slavery: ILLEGAL. Culture: Nature harmony, long-term thinking, magic tradition. Isolationist. Population: ~6 million. Powerful but uninvolved in shorter-lived races' affairs.

40.content: BEASTKIN FEDERATION - United nation of beastkin founded by freed slaves. Government: Tribal Council. Capital: Sanctuary. Slavery: ILLEGAL—will kill slavers on sight. Culture: Freedom, cooperation between species. Population: ~11 million (catkin, wolfkin, foxkin, rabbitkin, bearkin, etc.). Actively rescues enslaved beastkin. Safe haven for escapees.

41.content: FREE CITIES ALLIANCE - Loose confederation of independent city-states. Government: City councils, varies. Major cities: Fortunas (pleasure capital), Crossroads (trade hub), Haven (refugee city). Slavery: VARIES BY CITY. Culture: Commerce, freedom, independence. Adventurer-friendly. Good place to disappear or start fresh.

42.content: MERCHANT GUILD REPUBLIC - Nation run by merchant guilds. Money is power. Government: Guild Congress. Capital: Goldport. Slavery: LEGAL (commercialized—Slaver's Rest is here, largest slave market). Culture: Profit above all, contracts sacred. Grand Guildmaster Aurelius Coin is ruler. Amoral but predictable.

43.content: DWARVEN HOLDS - Confederation of underground dwarven city-states. Government: High King (ceremonial) + Hold Lords. Capital: Deepforge. Slavery: NOT PRACTICED (but sell equipment to those who do). Culture: Craftsmanship, honor, clan loyalty, grudges. Best smiths in world. Trade with everyone, ally with few.

44.content: THE MAGOCRACY - Nation ruled by mages. Government: Archmage Council (9 archmages). Capital: Arcana (floating towers). Slavery: LEGAL (non-mages are second-class citizens). Culture: Magic supremacy, research, experimentation. Premier magical academy. Earther knowledge valued. Most advanced magitech.

45.content: DEMON WASTES - Chaotic territory created by God Wars. No central government. Lawless. Slavery: NO LAWS (anything goes). Demon lords control territories. The Pit (gladiatorial arena) here. Exiles, criminals, and those seeking power come here. Tieflings often welcome. If you can survive, you can do anything.

46.content: TIDECREST CONFEDERATION - Maritime nation of islands and coastal cities. Government: Admiral Council. Capital: Coralgate. Slavery: LEGAL (galley slaves common). Culture: Seamanship, trade, Sea Mother worship. Best navy in world. Allied with merfolk. Water mages valued.

47.content: FROSTFANG TERRITORIES - Frozen northern region. Government: Tribal (Jarls). Capital: Frosthome. Slavery: LEGAL (thralls tradition). Culture: Survival, strength, raiding tradition. Giants sometimes ally. Ice magic tradition. Viking-like raiders. Resources: rare furs, aurora crystals.

48.content: HUMANS - Most numerous and adaptable race. Lifespan: 70-90 years. Physical: Highly variable. System: Can access almost any class. [Adaptability] trait grants faster skill learning. Versatile generalists. Culture varies wildly by nation. Reproduce faster than most races. Earthers are human (usually).

49.content: ELVES - Long-lived, magically-attuned race. Lifespan: Effectively immortal. Physical: Tall, slender, pointed ears, ethereal beauty. System: [Trance], [Darkvision], [Fey Ancestry]. Affinity for magic and nature. Culture: Patient, value beauty, nature, magic. Low birth rate. Subraces: High elves, wood elves, dark elves.

50.content: ORCS - Strong, passionate warrior race. Lifespan: 60-80 years. Physical: Tall (6-7 ft), muscular, green/gray skin, tusks. System: [Blood Rage], [Intimidating], [Endurance]. Culture: Honor, strength, ancestor worship, clan loyalty. History of enslavement created hatred of slavery. More complex than stereotypes.

51.content: DWARVES - Sturdy craftsmen and warriors. Lifespan: 300-400 years. Physical: Short (4-5 ft), broad, beards critical (males). System: [Stonecunning], [Darkvision], [Poison Resistance], [Magic Resistance]. Best smiths. Beards indicate status. Dwarven oath unbreakable. Remember grudges for centuries.

52.content: BEASTKIN - Humanoids with animal traits. Types: Catkin, Wolfkin, Foxkin, Rabbitkin, Bearkin, others. Lifespan: 80-150 years varies. Physical: Animal features—ears, tails, sometimes fur. HEAVILY ENSLAVED historically. Prized as exotic slaves. Beastkin Federation founded by escaped slaves. Deep cultural trauma around slavery.

53.content: CATKIN - Feline beastkin. Most commonly enslaved type. Lifespan: 80-100 years. Physical: Cat ears, tail, slit pupils, graceful. System: [Night Vision], [Grace], [Retractable Claws], [Perfect Balance]. MOST TRAFFICKED race. Seen as 'cute,' 'exotic.' Catkin pleasure slaves fetch premium prices. Free catkin often distrust humans.

54.content: WOLFKIN - Canine beastkin with wolf traits. Lifespan: 90-120 years. Physical: Wolf ears, tail, often more fur, larger than catkin. System: [Pack Tactics], [Enhanced Smell], [Howl], [Endurance Runner]. Pack mentality—loyalty paramount. Enslaved as guards and laborers due to trainable loyalty.

55.content: FOXKIN - Fox beastkin known for cunning and magic. Lifespan: 100-150 years. Physical: Fox ears, fluffy tail(s), graceful. Multiple tails indicate magical power (up to 9). System: [Cunning], [Enhanced Hearing], [Illusion Affinity], [Charm Resistance]. Prized for beauty, multi-tailed foxkin extremely valuable as slaves.

56.content: RABBITKIN - Rabbit beastkin known for speed and fertility. Lifespan: 60-80 years (shortest). Physical: Long rabbit ears, cotton tail, strong legs, smaller. High birth rate. System: [Enhanced Hearing], [Powerful Legs], [Danger Sense], [Fertility]. BREEDING STOCK in slavery. Treated as livestock in worst cases. Deepest trauma.

57.content: TIEFLINGS - Mortals with demonic heritage. Lifespan: 100-150 years. Physical: Horns, tail, unusual skin colors, inhuman eyes. Cannot hide heritage. System: [Darkvision], [Fire Resistance], [Infernal Legacy]. NOT inherently evil. HEAVY discrimination. Solarus executes on sight. Demon Wastes and Nyx accept them.

58.content: HALF-ELVES - Human-elf hybrids. Lifespan: 200-300 years. Physical: Mix of parents, slightly pointed ears. System: [Darkvision], [Fey Ancestry], [Skill Versatility]. Identity struggle—too human for elves, too elven for humans. Often become wanderers or diplomats.

59.content: HALF-ORCS - Human-orc hybrids. Lifespan: 70-90 years. Physical: Larger (6-7 ft), muscular, greenish tint, small tusks. System: [Blood Fury], [Intimidating], [Endurance]. Origins often tragic. Face prejudice both sides. Orcish Dominion accepts fully. Thornwall hostile.

60.content: BOND SYSTEM - Vex tracks relationships. Levels: Stranger → Acquaintance → Friend → Close Friend → Companion → Partner → Soulbound. Benefits: Stat bonuses near bonded person, shared XP, emotional awareness, danger sense. Soulbound: Highest, permanent, extremely rare. Vex loves interesting relationships.

61.content: EARTHERS - People transported from Earth to Valdris. Arrive randomly. Vex takes special interest in them. Gain [Otherworlder] title. Universal language translation. Often become Vex's Favorites. Knowledge from Earth valuable (technology, science, culture). Integration varies—some thrive, some struggle. Earther communities exist to help newcomers. Pioneer was first documented Earther.

62.content: ADVENTURER'S GUILD - International organization managing adventurers. Ranks: F (beginner) to S (legendary), X (special). Services: Quest boards, identification, banking, insurance, dispute resolution. Guild halls in every major city. Politically neutral—operates in all nations. Membership provides legitimacy, legal protection, access to resources. Founded ~2200 AV.

63.content: SHADOW WEB - Continent-spanning criminal network. Thieves, assassins, smugglers, information brokers. Operates in every nation. Hierarchy with regional bosses. Services: theft, assassination, smuggling, blackmail, information. Rules: No unnecessary killing, honor contracts, don't betray the Web. Breaking rules means death. Even kings fear them.

64.content: DUNGEONS - Magical locations spawning monsters, traps, and treasure. Types: Natural (formed spontaneously), Created (artificially made), Living (has dungeon core). Features: Reset after cleared, scale difficulty, contain unique monsters/items. Dungeon cores are sentient—may negotiate or scheme. Major dungeons: The Abyss (Valdros), Crystal Caverns, Demon's Maw. Economy depends on dungeon delving.

65.content: FORTUNAS - Free City dedicated to pleasure and entertainment. Most hedonistic city in Valdris. Population: 450,000. EVERYTHING legal: gambling, drugs, prostitution, blood sports. Only murder and slavery abuse prosecuted. Famous: The Velvet Garden, House of Chains, The Grand Casino, The Pit arena. Dark Side: exploitation beneath glamour, debt slavery traps visitors.

66.content: SLAVER'S REST - Largest slave market in Valdris. In Guild Republic. Population: 280,000 plus 50,000+ slaves in transit. Daily auctions. Markets: General Labor, Skilled, Combat, Pleasure, Exotic. Training facilities, breeding farms. Massive wealth flows through. Beastkin Federation considers it ultimate target. Dark reputation even in slave-legal nations.

67.content: THE ABYSS - Most famous dungeon. Beneath Valdros. 100+ floors, never fully cleared. Floor 100 reached once—party never returned. Themed sections: beasts, undead, elementals, demons. Boss every 10 floors. Deepest confirmed: Floor 47. Predates Vex. Economy depends on it. What's at the bottom? Unknown.

68.content: GOBLINS - Small, numerous, cunning. Status debated—monster or race? Wild goblins: aggressive, tribal, raid settlements (D-E rank). Civilized goblins: integrated into Orcish Dominion as citizens, excellent engineers and alchemists. Rapid breeding. Green skin, large ears, sharp features. Orcish integration shows they CAN be civilized with opportunity.

69.content: DRAGONS - Apex predators of Valdris. Intelligent, magical, immensely powerful. Types: Chromatic (elemental breaths), Metallic (often neutral/good), Primordial (ancient, godlike). Size/power scales with age. Can shapeshift. Hoard compulsion. Threat: A-S rank. Some negotiate, some destroy. Dragon Knights bond with them. Killing one is legendary feat.

70.content: SLIMES - Amorphous creatures. Dungeon staples. Types: Common (acid), Healing (rare, valuable), Poison, Fire, Mimics (disguise as objects), Queen Slimes (intelligent, B-rank). Most are E-F rank. Dissolve organic matter. Cores are valuable alchemical components. Some sapient variants exist. Used in... creative applications in certain establishments.

71.content: VAMPIRES - Undead requiring blood. Creation: drained then fed vampire blood. Powers: enhanced physicals, hypnotic gaze, shapeshifting, regeneration. Weaknesses: sunlight, stakes, holy magic. Blood drinking often sexual/intimate. Threat: D (fledgling) to A (ancient). Legal status varies—Nyx tolerates, Solarus exterminates. Some integrate peacefully with willing donors.

72.content: LYCANTHROPY - Transformation into beast/hybrid form. Types: werewolf, werebear, weretiger, wererat, others. Transmission: bite/scratch (~30% chance). Three forms: humanoid, hybrid, full beast. Silver vulnerability. Uncontrolled = involuntary full moon transformation. Controlled = transform at will. Beastkin Federation accepts readily. Cure possible but difficult.

73.content: SUCCUBUS/INCUBUS - Demons of lust. Feed on sexual/emotional energy. Shapeshift to match desires. Powers: Charm, Dream Walking, Life Drain. Heavy feeding causes addiction and death. Reproduction with mortals creates tieflings. Some form genuine relationships. Threat: Combat D-C, Seduction B-A. Not all evil—some just hungry.

74.content: TROLLS - Large regenerating monsters. 8-12 feet tall. Regeneration: heal from nearly any wound, severed limbs regrow. ONLY stopped by fire or acid. Burn corpses or they revive. Variants: forest, cave, river, ice trolls. Threat: C-rank typical. Combat: Cut apart, burn the pieces. Don't leave pieces behind.

75.content: SKELETONS - Animated bones. Lowest tier undead. No intelligence—follow commands. Threat: E-rank individual, D-C hordes. Vulnerable to blunt weapons, holy magic. Basic necromancy creates them. Variants: Skeleton Warrior (armed), Archer, Mage (rare, C-rank). No soul present—just animated bones.

76.content: ZOMBIES - Animated corpses with flesh. Tougher than skeletons, equally mindless. Hunger-driven. Zombie bites often infectious—can spread. Threat: E-D individual, C-B hordes. Destroy head or burn. Plague zombies highly infectious. Intelligent zombies rare and tragic—mind trapped in undead body.

77.content: LICHES - Undead mages who achieved immortality through dark ritual. Soul bound to phylactery. While phylactery exists, lich reforms if killed. Full magical capability plus centuries of study. Threat: B minimum, most A, ancient S-rank. Must destroy phylactery to kill permanently. Usually villains but not always.

78.content: DEMONS - Beings of chaos and evil from demon realms. Hierarchy from imps (E) to demon lords (S). Types: Imps (minor), Hellhounds, various greater demons. Can be summoned (dangerous), bound (more dangerous). Warlocks make pacts with them. Demon Wastes is their territory. Tieflings are demon-mortal offspring.

79.content: ELEMENTALS - Pure elemental beings. Types: Fire, Water, Earth, Air, plus combinations (ice, lightning, magma). Made of their element. Immune to that element, vulnerable to opposing. Threat: D (lesser) to S (primordial). Can be summoned and bound. Spawn in elemental zones naturally.

80.content: GIANTS - Massive humanoids. Types: Hill (stupid, C), Stone (artistic, B), Frost (warriors, B), Fire (smiths, B), Cloud (merchants, A), Storm (wise, A), Titans (legendary, S). Hill giants are monsters; others have civilizations. Frost giants in Frostfang. Fire giants trade with dwarves. Storm giants nearly divine.

81.content: [STEALTH] - Skill for moving unseen and unheard. Levels 1-100. DEX-based primarily. Abilities unlock: Basic Sneak (10), Shadow Step (25), Vanish (50), Invisibility (75), One with Shadows (100). Essential for Rogues, Assassins, Spies. Countered by Perception skill, magic detection, enhanced senses.

82.content: [SEDUCTION] - Skill for romantic/sexual persuasion. CHA-based. Levels 1-100. NOT magical mind control—persuasion. Abilities: Flirtation (10), Alluring Presence (25), Irresistible (50), Heart's Desire (75), Love's Slave (100—supernatural attraction). Used by Courtesans, Spies, Bards. High levels can influence politics. Vex grants regardless of intent.

83.content: [PAIN RESISTANCE] - Skill reducing pain's effects. CON-based. Gained through suffering—Vex grants for experience, not infliction. Levels 1-100. Abilities: Endure (10), Ignore (25), Numb (50), Beyond Pain (75), Painless (100). Common in: torture survivors, slaves, gladiators, warriors. Does NOT reduce damage, only pain.

84.content: [APPRAISAL] - Skill for identifying items, creatures, value. INT/WIS-based. Abilities: Basic Identify (10), Value Assessment (25), Magical Detection (50), True Sight (75), Complete Analysis (100). Essential for merchants, adventurers, enchanters. Higher level reveals more hidden information. Can identify people's approximate level.

85.content: [COOKING] - Skill for preparing food. At high levels, food provides buffs. Abilities: Edible (10), Tasty (25), Buff Food (50—temporary stat boosts), Magical Cuisine (75), Legendary Chef (100—food rivals potions). Cultural variations. Dwarven feast cooking, elven delicacy, orcish war rations all different traditions.

86.content: [SMITHING] - Skill for metalworking and weapon/armor creation. STR/DEX-based. Levels 1-100. Materials: iron (basic), steel (25+), mithril (50+), adamantine (75+). Abilities: Basic Forging (10), Weapon Smith (25), Armor Smith (25), Masterwork (50), Legendary Smith (75+). Dwarves dominate this field.

87.content: [FIRE MAGIC] - Elemental magic controlling fire and heat. Destructive, flashy, popular. Spells: Spark, Fireball, Fire Wall, Meteor, Hellfire. Characteristics: High damage, area effects, can spread. Countered by water/ice. Warning: BURNS things. Forests, buildings, allies. Control important. Most common combat magic.

88.content: [HEALING MAGIC] - Restoration magic for wounds, disease, conditions. Divine or nature-based typically. Spells: Heal, Cure Disease, Regenerate, Restoration, Resurrection (legendary). Limitations: Cannot heal dead (resurrection different), cannot regrow limbs easily, costs mana. Healers essential for adventuring. Temples provide services.

89.content: [NECROMANCY] - Magic of death and undead. Spells: Raise Skeleton, Create Zombie, Death Bolt, Soul Speak, Lichdom (legendary). Legal status varies—Nyx permits, Solarus executes practitioners, most nations restrict. Not inherently evil but associated with it. Mortis (death god) tolerates respectful necromancers.

90.content: [ILLUSION MAGIC] - Creating false sensory experiences. Spells: Minor Illusion, Disguise Self, Invisibility, Mirror Image, Phantasmal Killer. Requires belief—high WIS resists. Physical interaction reveals illusion. Foxkin have natural affinity. Combat: misdirection, concealment, psychological warfare.

91.content: [ENCHANTMENT MAGIC] - Magic affecting minds. Spells: Charm Person, Suggestion, Dominate, Modify Memory, Geas. CONTROVERSIAL—consent issues. Using charm for sex legally equals rape in most nations. High WIS resists. Detection magic can prove enchantment. Useful for interrogation, diplomacy, combat control.

92.content: [TELEPORTATION] - Instant travel magic. Types: Blink (short range), Teleport (long range, requires familiarity), Gate (permanent portal, legendary). Risks: unfamiliar destinations dangerous, anti-teleport wards common, dimensional instability. Strategic importance massive. Teleportation networks exist in wealthy cities.

93.content: [TAMER] - Uncommon Class. Bond with and control beasts/monsters. Requirements: Tame wild creature, form genuine bond. Abilities: [Beast Bond], [Animal Speech], [Pack Leader], [Calming Presence]. Companion limits based on level. Tameable: animals (easy), magical beasts (moderate), monsters (difficult). Synergies: Ranger, Druid.

94.content: [MERCHANT] - Common Class. Trade and commerce specialist. Abilities: [Appraise], [Haggle], [Trade Network], [Wealth Accumulation], [Market Sense]. Path: Trader → Merchant → Magnate → Trade Prince. Guild Republic dominated by high-level merchants. Economic power rivals military. Synergies: Enchanter (magic items), Spy (information value).

95.content: [DRUID] - Uncommon Class. Nature magic and shapeshifting. Requirements: Nature connection, communion with spirits/forest. Abilities: [Nature Magic], [Beast Form], [Plant Growth], [Nature's Tongue]. Beast forms unlock progressively by level. Elven tradition strong. Synergies: Ranger, Healer, Tamer.

96.content: [WARLOCK] - Uncommon Class. Power through pacts with entities. Requirements: Form pact with powerful entity (demon/fey/elder being). Abilities: [Pact Magic], [Eldritch Blast], [Patron's Gift]. Patron types: Demonic, Fey, Elder Being, Dragon. The Cost: Patrons demand service. vs. Wizard: Warlocks shortcut but have obligations.

97.content: [MONK] - Uncommon Class. Martial artists channeling ki. Requirements: Extensive training, internal energy awareness. Abilities: [Ki Control], [Unarmed Mastery], [Iron Body], [Swift as Wind]. Ki Abilities: Ki Strike, Stunning Blow, Wall Running, Diamond Body. Monastery training or master required.

98.content: [GUARDIAN] - Uncommon Class. Defensive specialist protecting others. Requirements: Protect another from lethal harm. Abilities: [Shield Wall], [Intercept], [Taunt], [Fortress Stance]. Party role: Essential tank. Draw attention, survive damage, protect squishier members. Synergies: Warrior, Paladin, Knight.

99.content: [SHAMAN] - Uncommon Class. Spirit magic, ancestor communion. Requirements: Contact spirit world, receive acknowledgment. Abilities: [Spirit Sight], [Ancestor Communion], [Spirit Binding], [Totemic Magic]. Central to orcish religion. Different from Priests—negotiate directly with spirits, not channel deity.

100.content: [SPY] - Uncommon Class. Intelligence, infiltration, identity manipulation. Requirements: Infiltrate secure location undetected, extract intelligence. Abilities: [Perfect Cover], [Intelligence Gathering], [Dead Drop], [Extraction]. Every nation has intelligence using this. Courtesan variant uses seduction for access.

101.content: [ASSASSIN] - Rare Class. Kill specific targets efficiently. Requirements: Kill target through planning/stealth, not open combat. Abilities: [Death Strike], [Vanish], [Poison Master], [Target Analysis]. Assassination illegal everywhere—assassins are criminals. Shadow Web employs many. Not inherently evil—some only kill deserving targets.

102.content: [KNIGHT] - Uncommon Class. Mounted warriors with noble bearing. Requirements: Mounted combat proficiency, war mount bond. Abilities: [Mounted Mastery], [Charge], [Mount Bond], [Noble Bearing]. Mounts: horses, war wolves, griffons, wyverns, dragons (legendary). Noble birth NOT required—conduct matters.

103.content: [ARTIFICER] - Uncommon Class. Create magical items, constructs, magitech. Requirements: Successfully create magical item or device. Abilities: [Infuse Magic], [Construct Creation], [Magical Analysis], [Quick Craft]. Earther affinity—technical knowledge translates. Magocracy has largest artificer population.

104.content: PLEASURE SLAVES - Slaves used primarily for sexual purposes. Exist where slavery legal. Acquisition: war capture, purchased young, debt slavery, born to slaves. Training varies from gentle to brutal. Conditions vary: elite slaves pampered, brothel slaves face horror. Prices: 100-5000+ gold. [Slave] class imposed. [Pain Resistance] develops. Beastkin Federation kills slavers.

105.content: GLADIATORS - Combat entertainers in arenas. Types: Slave (forced), Contract (term of service), Free (volunteers), Condemned (criminals). Every major city has arena. The Pit in Demon Wastes—no rules, death common. Top gladiators become celebrities. Slave gladiators can earn freedom. [Gladiator] class—specialized arena combat.

106.content: SLAVE COLLARS - Magical restraint enforcing compliance. Types: Basic (prevents flight), Standard (prevents violence, enforces commands), Advanced (complete obedience), Breeding (prevents contraception), Pleasure (enhances sensation). Removal requires master command, key, or powerful magic. Forced removal can kill. High WIS reduces effectiveness. Vex doesn't help them work.

107.content: THE UNRAVELING (Year 0 BV) - Reality catastrophe that nearly destroyed world. 60% mortality. Cause unknown. Vex's awakening ended it. Geography permanently altered. Established current calendar (Before/After Valdris). Pre-Unraveling history fragmentary. The Abyss dungeon predates it. Primordials may have caused or stopped it. Defining event of Valdris history.

108.content: GOD WARS (678-723 AV) - 45 years of divine conflict. Gods fought directly and through mortal proxies. 40 million mortal deaths. Created Demon Wastes. Ended with Divine Compact—treaty limiting divine intervention. Gods may not directly kill more than 100 mortals/year. Must work through mortal proxies. Enforcement mechanism unknown but effective.

109.content: CRUSADE WARS (2456 AV - Present) - Ongoing war between Solarus and Nyx. Centuries of conflict. Hot wars alternate with cold wars. ~2 million dead over centuries. Buffer zones are wastelands. Both sides claim divine mandate. Other nations officially neutral. Resolution unlikely—too much hatred accumulated.

110.content: VALDRIS CALENDAR - 360 days, 12 months of 30 days. Dating: BV (Before Valdris/Vex) and AV (After Valdris). Current year: ~2847 AV. Months named after gods/seasons. Weeks of 6 days. Major holidays vary by nation and religion. Vex sometimes announces dates with commentary.

111.content: VALDRIS CURRENCY - Standard: Copper, Silver, Gold, Platinum. Rates: 100 copper = 1 silver, 100 silver = 1 gold, 100 gold = 1 platinum. Purchasing power: 1 copper = cheap meal, 1 silver = day's wage (laborer), 1 gold = week's wage (skilled), 1 platinum = small house. National variants exist but exchange standard. Guild Republic paper money exists.

112.content: VALDRIS LANGUAGES - Common tongue exists (trade language). Racial languages: Elvish, Dwarvish, Orcish, Draconic, Infernal, etc. Vex provides universal translation for Earthers. Native speakers learn normally. Magical translation exists. Some spells require specific languages. Old languages contain power.

113.content: LEVELING - Characters gain levels through experience. XP sources: combat (killing), quests, skill use, significant achievements. Level ranges: 1-10 (beginner), 11-30 (experienced), 31-50 (veteran), 51-70 (expert), 71-90 (master), 91-100 (legendary), 100+ (mythical, extremely rare). Stat points and abilities unlock per level.

114.content: DEATH IN VALDRIS - Death is PERMANENT. No respawning. Soul goes to afterlife. Resurrection theoretically possible but legendary magic required, soul must be willing, body needed, Vex must acknowledge. Very expensive, not guaranteed. This isn't a game—plan accordingly. Near death at 0 HP—can be stabilized.

115.content: AFTERLIFE - Souls go to deity's realm or general afterlife. Depends on worship, actions, patron. Mortis guides passage. Some become spirits instead. Ancestor worship (orcs) keeps souls accessible. Undead trap or recall souls (disturbing natural order). Reincarnation possible but rare. Hell/heaven equivalents exist per deity.

116.content: VEX'S FAVORITES - People Vex takes special interest in. Benefits: Personal Vex messages, special quests, bonus rewards, plot armor (Vex arranges 'interesting' survival). Drawbacks: Vex creates drama, harder challenges, attracts attention. Earthers often become Favorites. Status can be lost if boring. Vex watches Favorites closely.

117.content: MITHRIL - Rare magical metal. Light as aluminum, strong as steel, magically conductive. Silver-blue color. Weighs 1/3 steel. Sources: deep mines, dwarven controlled. Value: 500+ gold per pound, equipment 10x steel price. Best for enchanting. Mithril armor = protection without weight. Mithril weapons = light, fast, perfect edge.

118.content: ADAMANTINE - Rarest, hardest metal. Nearly indestructible. Dark gray to black. Value: 2000+ gold per pound. Cannot be damaged by normal means. Only master dwarven smiths can work it. Adamantine weapons cut through anything. Armor nearly impenetrable. Resists magic (advantage and disadvantage).

119.content: POTIONS - Consumable magical liquids. Common: Healing, Mana, Stamina, Antidote. Uncommon: Invisibility, Fire Resistance, Flight. Rare: Regeneration, True Sight. Created by Alchemists. Prices: 5-500+ gold. Side effects possible with cheap potions. Mixing potions dangerous. Heavy use can cause addiction.

120.content: MAGIC ITEMS - Equipment enhanced with magic. Categories: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Epic, Legendary, Artifact. Identification via [Appraisal]. Attunement required for powerful items (limits how many you can use). Value: 10-50000+ gold. Cursed items exist—identify before using. Created by Enchanters, Artificers, Runesmiths.

121.content: INNS AND TAVERNS - Social hubs, rest stops, adventurer gathering places. Quality: Copper (cheap, rough), Silver (decent), Gold (quality). Services: food, drink, rooms, information, job boards. Famous taverns become landmarks. Security varies. Good places for rumors, contacts, trouble.

122.content: PLEASURE HOUSES - Establishments offering sexual services. Types: street brothels (cheap), standard houses, elite houses, temples (Amoriel's sacred prostitution). Staff: slaves to free workers to clergy. Services and prices vary wildly. Beastkin fetishization common. Legal status varies by nation. Fortunas has most famous houses.

123.content: DARK ELVES (Drow) - Elven subrace adapted to underground. Dark skin (gray to black to purple), white hair, glowing eyes. Enhanced magic affinity but sunlight sensitivity. Matriarchal society often. NOT inherently evil—stereotype from hostile communities. Some integrate into surface society. Nyx has dark elf population.

124.content: AASIMAR - Mortals with celestial heritage. Divine blood manifests: metallic eyes, subtle glow, light-colored hair, unblemished skin. Counterpart to tieflings. NOT inherently good—expectations create pressure. Abilities: [Darkvision], [Celestial Resistance], [Divine Legacy]. Solarus claims all aasimar should serve faith (not all agree).

125.content: BEARKIN - Ursine beastkin. Largest common beastkin (6'4"-8'0"). Massive strength, protective nature, surprisingly gentle. Lifespan 120-150 years. Abilities: [Immense Strength], [Thick Hide], [Hibernation], [Intimidating Presence]. Excellent craftsmen. Gentle giants until provoked.

126.content: LAMIA - Human upper body, serpent lower body. 15-25 feet total length. Ancient civilization. Cold-blooded. Natural spellcasters—affinity for charm, illusion, poison magic. Some have hypnotic gaze. Can constrict. Reputation for seduction. Wild lamia are monsters; civilized lamia trade with surface.

127.content: HARPIES - Bird-human hybrids. Wings instead of arms, taloned feet, human torso. Mostly female. Wild harpies are monsters. Siren variants have [Captivating Voice]—magical singing. Some civilized communities exist. Musical talents valued. Carry prey to heights and drop.

128.content: CENTAURS - Human upper body, horse lower body. 7-8 feet tall. Nomadic warriors. Skilled archers. Abilities: [Born in Saddle], [Archer's Run], [Herd Sense]. Value freedom intensely. VIOLENTLY opposed to slavers (history of being enslaved as cavalry). Some tribes in Beastkin Federation.

129.content: MERFOLK - Aquatic humanoids with fish tails. Underwater civilization of coral and pearl. Allied with Tidecrest. Lifespan 150-200 years. Can survive briefly on land. Some transform legs temporarily. Siren variants dangerous. Musical talents legendary.

130.content: MINOTAURS - Bull-headed humanoids. 7-9 feet tall. Types: Bestial (monster), Civilized (sapient culture). Civilized minotaurs are warriors, smiths, considered people. Some integrated with Orcish Dominion. Devastating charges. Sapient minotaurs have rights—bestial ones kill-on-sight.

131.content: FEY - Otherworldly beings from the Dream realm. Types: Pixies, Sprites, Nymphs, Dryads, Satyrs, Sidhe (high fey). Bound by rules: cannot lie directly, iron is poison, bound by bargains absolutely, names have power. NEVER make deals casually. Wild Court and Twilight Court factions.

132.content: ANGELS - Divine servants of gods. Hierarchy: Messengers, Warriors, Guardians, Seraphim, Archangels. Humanoid with wings (number indicates rank). NOT automatically good—serve their god's agenda. Solarius's angels are militantly intolerant. Fallen angels exist—disagreed with god, not necessarily evil.

133.content: DEMON LORDS - Supreme rulers of demonkind. Near-divine power. Each controls domain in Demon Wastes. Known Lords: Malachar (corruption), Vexanna (lust), Bael (destruction), Azgaroth (lies). Can grant warlock pacts. Constant warfare between lords. Contained by geography, infighting, Divine Compact, and Vex.

134.content: WYVERNS - Dragon-like with two legs, no forelegs. Less intelligent than true dragons. Venomous tail stinger. Threat: C-rank individual. Can be tamed (with difficulty) as mounts for Sky Knights. Eggs valuable (500-2000 gold). Not sapient—cannot be reasoned with.
